availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Bernard Poage (Lawrence County, Kentucky, merchant, minister, and deputy court clerk)

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, merchant, minister, and deputy court clerk. Kentucky native. Son of William Poage and Eliza Van Horn Poage. Married to Lucy Jane Hubanks Poage in July 1846. Father of George B. Poage, Henry H. Poage, and James E. Poage. Merchant in Lawrence County, Kentucky, in 1850. Minister for the Methodist Episcopal Church, South, in Lawrence County in 1860. Deputy court clerk in Lawrence County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 86A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 654.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Brooksville, p. 334A.
Sons of the American Revolution Membership Applications, 1889-1970, National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution, Louisville, Ky, Poage, National #51746, State #712.
KYR-0001-031-0089.
